result.execSummary:
The defendant Vashawn Ladonte Cox was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank; pay surcharge and pay all other applicable court costs and surcharges to be deducted from prison wages or by 11-02-15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vashawn Ladonte Cox

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Vashawn Ladonte Cox not in court.  Thaddeus P McGuire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DEFENDANT IS DECEASED.
ANY FINE/FORFEITURES, COSTS, ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES TO BE WAIVED.
ANY OUTSTANDING CIVIL JUDGMENTS, FINE & COST COMMITMENTS, SUSPENSIONS FOR DRIVING PRIVILEGES TO BE VACATED AND/OR WITHDRAWN.
Court for Proof of death notification received from D.O.C. on this date and forwarded to review.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (14 pages) commencing AUGUST 4, 2015 received and filed.

Defendant Vashawn Ladonte Cox in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Vashawn Ladonte Cox in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Statements made as to sentencing.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS and 6 MONTHS, with credit for 131 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR and 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs to be deducted from prison wages or by 11.2.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges to be deducted from prison wages or by 11.2.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 

Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Vashawn Ladonte Cox not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 7.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-04-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Vashawn Ladonte Cox in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Vashawn Ladonte Cox in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-09-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Vashawn Ladonte Cox not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 7.  Plea hearing scheduled for 05-28-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Vashawn Ladonte Cox in court with attorney Mark Dluzak for Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Vashawn Ladonte Cox in custody.  Ron Dague for Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Andrew Farina-MPD Detective. Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #11CF190 that are attached to the complaint.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.    
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Vashawn Ladonte Cox in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  
Defendant Vashawn Ladonte Cox in custody.  
Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Vashawn Ladonte Cox
Current: 2877 N 23rd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206   (Effective: 03-29-2015)
Prior: 3745 North 22nd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
